data.description: Handles the formal and informal public engagement moments during AMDAL review. May trigger public hearings, grievance response loops, or community escalations.

notes.informal_notes: Although hearings are legally required only above a threshold, local NGOs or political actors can pressure the commission to hold them. Villages may treat participation as entitlement.
notes.symbolic_scaffold: Hearings serve as rituals of legitimacy, especially when chaired by respected figures or covered by local media.
notes.feedback_structure: Public feedback is captured in formal records, but incorporation is uneven. DLH may act as filter, shaping what reaches decision-makers.
failure_modes: Hearing process hijacked by rival land interests
Community boycott or protest due to perceived lack of benefit
Delays due to conflicting interpretations of participation rules
